unnormalised: The Delhi Health Dept. is really streamlining things, folks! Or at least, they *think* they are. Apparently, scribbling "HealthCard123" on a piece of paper and calling it a national identifier wasn't cutting it. Shocking, I know.
normalised: The Delhi Health Department is really streamlining things, folks! Or at least, they *think* they are. Apparently, scribbling "Health Card one two three" on a piece of paper and calling it a national identifier wasn't cutting it. Shocking, I know.

unnormalised: So now we've got the "AarogyaSahayakID," or ASI, which sounds suspiciously like a Bollywood superhero. Mine starts with "ASI-DL-2024-LOL" – seriously, "LOL"? Are they expecting us to die laughing at our medical bills? My wife, Priya's, is "ASI-HR-2024-BRB." Does that mean she's expecting a quick trip to the ICU?
normalised: So now we've got the "Aarogya Sahayak I-D," or A-S-I, which sounds suspiciously like a Bollywood superhero. Mine starts with "A-S-I-D-L-two thousand and twenty four-L-O-L" – seriously, "L-O-L"? Are they expecting us to die laughing at our medical bills? My wife, Priya's, is "A-S-I-H-R-two thousand and twenty four-B-R-B." Does that mean she's expecting a quick trip to the I-C-U?

unnormalised: The insurance companies are having a field day. Bajaj Allianz is now asking for your "LegacyHealthID," your "NewAarogyaRefNum," *and* your grandmother's maiden name, just to process a claim for a cough syrup. Godrej Healthcare is pushing the "WellnessPlusCard," with IDs like "WPC-MUM-08-BAAPRE." "Baapre"? As in, "Oh, my god, this paperwork is insane!"? Accurate.
normalised: The insurance companies are having a field day. Bajaj Allianz is now asking for your "Legacy Health I-D," your "New Aarogya Ref Num," *and* your grandmother's maiden name, just to process a claim for a cough syrup. Godrej Healthcare is pushing the "Wellness Plus Card," with I-Ds like "W-P-C-M-U-M-zero eight-B-A-A-P-R-E." "Baapre"? As in, "Oh, my god, this paperwork is insane!"? Accurate.

unnormalised: And don't even get me started on the "AyushmanBharatUniqueCode," or ABUC. My uncle Rakesh's ABUC is "ABUC-UP-69-420" – yes, you read that right. He's convinced they're trying to tell him something about his blood pressure. He’s threatening to file a PIL. Good luck with that, Uncle. You'll probably need another identifier for the court proceedings.
normalised: And don't even get me started on the "Ayushman Bharat Unique Code," or A-B-U-C. My uncle Rakesh's A-B-U-C is "A-B-U-C-U-P-six nine-four two zero" – yes, you read that right. He's convinced they're trying to tell him something about his blood pressure. He’s threatening to file a P-I-L. Good luck with that, Uncle. You'll probably need another identifier for the court proceedings.

unnormalised: The government assures us this is all to "enhance efficiency." I think they mean efficiently confuse us into giving up on healthcare altogether. Imagine trying to explain all these IDs to your elderly parents, who still think the internet is a fad. "No, Amma, it's not the 'Internet Card,' it's the 'AarogyaSahayakID'!"
normalised: The government assures us this is all to "enhance efficiency." I think they mean efficiently confuse us into giving up on healthcare altogether. Imagine trying to explain all these I-Ds to your elderly parents, who still think the internet is a fad. "No, Amma, it's not the 'Internet Card,' it's the 'Aarogya Sahayak I-D'!"

unnormalised: My doctor, Dr. Sharma, bless her soul, just sighs and says, "Just write down everything you can remember on a piece of paper, beta. We'll figure it out eventually." At this rate, "remembering" will be a billable medical procedure.
normalised: My doctor, Doctor Sharma, bless her soul, just sighs and says, "Just write down everything you can remember on a piece of paper, beta. We'll figure it out eventually." At this rate, "remembering" will be a billable medical procedure.

unnormalised: I predict a booming business for "Healthcare ID Consultants" who charge Rs. 500/hour to decipher the alphabet soup. At least *they'll* be enhancing *their* efficiency. Me? I'm off to meditate and try to forget my "ASI-DL-2024-LOL" before it gives me an actual heart attack.
normalised: I predict a booming business for "Healthcare I-D Consultants" who charge rupees five hundred per hour to decipher the alphabet soup. At least *they'll* be enhancing *their* efficiency. Me? I'm off to meditate and try to forget my "A-S-I-D-L-two thousand and twenty four-L-O-L" before it gives me an actual heart attack.
